column4: i was trying ubuntu livecd last week but since i coudn't get the wireless to work i gave up, i couldn't even get that compiz effects working whilst it was working on fedora and mandriva.  The gfx card is; "Graphics Card Type   INTEL GMA X3100"
I have a TOSHIBA EQUIUM A200-1VO
can anyone help?

i was trying ubuntu livecd last week but since i coudn't get the wireless to work i gave up, i couldn't even get that compiz effects working whilst it was working on fedora and mandriva.  The gfx card is; "Graphics Card Type   INTEL GMA X3100".  I have a TOSHIBA EQUIUM A200-1VO.  can anyone help?
hello? anyone get my question
compiz does not work on your system in 7.10
It will hopefully work in 8.04
yes nor the wireless card
If it is intel wireless it should work fine
If it is intel wireless it should work fine
But basically if it didn't work right away and it isn't broadcom it probably won't work, period
pastebin the output of lspci
http://pastebin.com/m478a65bb
this doesn't even list a wireless card, did you turn the killswitch on?
yes the wireless light is on the laptop
i dunno what to tell you, according to lspci your laptop does not even have a wireless card, let alone a driver for said card
pastebin lsusb
http://pastebin.com/m58186178
well that doesn't help :/
most likely
but we have drivers for some of those
and basically if a driver exists it is in ubuntu so a driver most likely does not exist for your wireless
because the driver cannot do compiz and Xv (video playback) at the same time
no, because a driver for it does not exist
